title: Anaphylactic shock (Anaphylaxis)
description: Type I IgE-mediated hypersensitivity reaction. Release of histamine and other agents causes: capillary leak; wheeze; cyanosis; oedema (larynx, lids, tongue, lips); urticaria. More common in atopic individuals.

title: Sepsis (Septic shock)
description: Sepsis Life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by a dysregulated host response to infection

title: Heat exposure (heat exhaustion)
description: Mentions key items in Heat exposure management.

title: Hemorrhagic shock
description: Mentions key items in Hemorrhagic shock management.

title: Hypovolemic shock
description: Mentions key items in Hypovolemic shock management.
